intro: Triumfetta rhomboidea var. pentandra, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It is a small, annual herb that typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it well adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments.
